posts.name: Mike
posts.cooked:
We’re having trouble getting our Rev through bore encoder working. We have it wired up to a 775 motor like the picture below (from the Rev website) with the through bore encoder wired into the SparkMax encoder port. We aren’t getting any errors in the code, but the value in the SmartDashboard isn’t showing the encoder reading.

image 889×720 55.5 KB

image 889×720 55.5 KB

image 889×720 55.5 KB

We wrote our code according to the Rev Github. Our code is in the picture below.

Any help would be appreciated! image 1297×483 43.9 KB

image 1297×483 43.9 KB

image 1297×483 43.9 KB

posts.name: Talha
posts.cooked: As my understanding, encoders directly connected to encoder port (the one above the power outputs) don’t considered as Alternate Encoders. You should be able to use them like elevatorMotor.getEncoder() .

posts.name: Mike
posts.cooked:
Whenever I try to use the getEncoder method on a brushed motor I get the error below when deploying to the Rio. According to the Rev website the through bore encoder has to be used as an alternate encoder.

A hall sensor cannot be used with a brushed motor

A hall sensor cannot be used with a brushed motor

at com.revrobotics.SparkMaxRelativeEncoder.(SparkMaxRelativeEncoder.java:85

at com.revrobotics.SparkMaxRelativeEncoder.(SparkMaxRelativeEncoder.java:85

posts.cooked: Apparently you need to specify encoder details if you are using this with a brushed motor. Try this:

posts.name: Talha
posts.cooked: There is a method that accepts SparkMaxRelativeEncoder.Type and int as parameters. I think you get this error because you use SparkMaxAlternateEncoder.Type , which is not your case.

data.fancy_title: Through bore encoder with brushed motor
data.title: Through bore encoder with brushed motor

accepted_answer.excerpt:
You are not assigning the RelativeEncoder you get from the getEncoder method to your elevatorEncoder variable. Correct code would be: 
elevatorEncoder = elevatorMotor.getEncoder(SparkMaxRelativeEncoder.Type.kQuadrature, 8092);
